alert.note: Alert for Catawba (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 10:29PM EDT until September 30 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Catawba. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain showers will continue to diminish across the advised area through midnight but elevated stream levels and lingering high water conditions will remain, hence the advisory is extended until midnight, - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Newton, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Maiden, Claremont, Catawba, Mountain View, Lake Hickory, Lake Norman, Sherrills Ford, Startown, Propst, Bandys, Cooksville and Terrell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
